# Writing academic papers

- [jtleek/firstpaper](https://github.com/jtleek/firstpaper): Writing your first academic paper


- [Ten simple rules for structuring papers](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005619#sec003)  
	- This paper gives a helpful overview and structure to help organize the contents a paper as seen below
 ![](https://storage.googleapis.com/plos-corpus-prod/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005830/1/pcbi.1005830.g001.PNG_I?X-Goog-Algorithm=GOOG4-RSA-SHA256&X-Goog-Credential=wombat-sa%40plos-prod.iam.gserviceaccount.com%2F20210414%2Fauto%2Fstorage%2Fgoog4_request&X-Goog-Date=20210414T144656Z&X-Goog-Expires=3600&X-Goog-SignedHeaders=host&X-Goog-)


## Writing collaboratively

- [manubot/manubot: Manubot: Manuscripts, open and automated](https://github.com/manubot/manubot)
- [PeerJ/paper-now: Create, edit and display a journal article, entirely in GitHub](https://github.com/PeerJ/paper-now)  (Not active)
  
## Writing Review papers

### Collaboratively writing review paper

This could be the future of writing review papers: expert collaborating with an 'open contribution model'. 

- See example of [The Deep Review](https://github.com/greenelab/deep-review) : [Opportunities and obstacles for deep learning in biology and medicine | Journal of The Royal Society Interface](https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/10.1098/rsif.2017.0387)
